name: Bhaktapur
fun_fact: Fun fact: Bhaktapur's Juju Dhau (King Curd) is made in clay pots using a secret recipe passed down for centuries, and locals say the clay from Bhaktapur's soil gives it a unique flavor that can't be replicated anywhere else in Nepal.

hero_dishes.name: Juju Dhau (King Curd)
hero_dishes.description: Creamy, sweetened yogurt made from buffalo milk, served in traditional clay pots. The texture is thick and rich, with a subtle sweetness.
hero_dishes.origin_story: Known as the 'king of yogurts', this Bhaktapur specialty has been perfected over centuries by local Newari families. The secret recipe and Bhaktapur's unique clay pots give it a flavor that cannot be replicated elsewhere.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Small shops throughout Bhaktapur, especially around Durbar Square and Taumadhi Square

hero_dishes.name: Bara
hero_dishes.description: Savory lentil pancake made from black lentils, topped with spiced buffalo meat and eggs, served with aromatic kwati bean broth.
hero_dishes.origin_story: A traditional Newari dish that has been a breakfast staple for generations. The lentil batter is fermented overnight, giving it a distinctive tangy flavor.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Aama ko Bara Pasal (next to Nyatapola temple, established in the early 1970s, serving over 300 people daily)

hero_dishes.name: Samay Baji
hero_dishes.description: Ceremonial platter with beaten rice (chiura), buffalo meat, boiled eggs, black soybeans, and pickled vegetables.
hero_dishes.origin_story: An auspicious dish served during Newari feasts and celebrations. Each component represents different aspects of Newari culture and is arranged in a specific traditional pattern.
hero_dishes.where_to_find: Newa Lahana, The Nanee (offers both traditional and contemporary interpretations)

hero_dishes.name: Choila
hero_dishes.description: Spicy grilled buffalo meat marinated in local herbs, spices, and mustard oil, with a smoky, fiery flavor.
hero_dishes.origin_story: A traditional Newari dish originally prepared during festivals and special occasions. The meat is charred over open flames and mixed with fenugreek, ginger, and chilies.

signature_drinks.name: Chyang (Newari Rice Beer)
signature_drinks.description: Traditional fermented rice beer with a slightly sour, mildly alcoholic taste.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Served in traditional clay cups during festivals and family gatherings, often alongside samay baji and other Newari dishes.

signature_drinks.name: Lassi
signature_drinks.description: Thick yogurt-based drink, sometimes flavored with fruit or spices.
signature_drinks.how_locals_drink_it: Often consumed after meals to aid digestion, especially popular during hot afternoons in Bhaktapur's squares.

food_culture_notes: Bhaktapur's food scene is dominated by Newari cuisine, with recipes perfected over hundreds of years
The real culinary treasures are found in small alleyways, not the tourist-heavy Durbar Square restaurants
Many eateries have been run by the same families for decades, with Aama ko Bara Pasal's owner serving bara for 44 years
Clay pots are essential to Bhaktapur's food culture, used for both cooking and serving traditional dishes like Juju Dhau
